pages.text: Senariocrinus maucheri is a species of calceocrinid crinoid, known from one specimen from the Hunsr√ºck Shale of lower Devonian Germany. It is an odd member of calceocrinids, mixing extremely derived features with basal ones, and as such it is thought to be a basal offshoot of calceocrinids. Its original description thought it would have used its anal tube and left anterior arm to propel itself as a swimmer, but later publications have disproven this.
